ada.name: Ada
ada.description: A structured, statically typed, imperative, and object-oriented high-level programming language, designed for safety-critical systems.
ada.trivia: Named after Ada Lovelace, often considered the first computer programmer.

agda.name: Agda
agda.description: A dependently typed functional programming language and proof assistant.

asm.name: Assembly
asm.description: Low-level programming language with a strong correspondence to machine code instructions.
asm.trivia: Each assembly language is specific to a particular computer architecture.

awk.name: AWK
awk.inventor: Alfred Aho, Peter Weinberger, Brian Kernighan
awk.description: A domain-specific language designed for text processing and data extraction.
awk.trivia: The name comes from the initials of its three creators: Aho, Weinberger, and Kernighan.

bash.name: Bash
bash.description: The Bourne Again SHell, a Unix shell and command language.
bash.trivia: Bash is the default shell on most Linux distributions and macOS (until Catalina).

batch.name: Batch
batch.description: A scripting language for Windows command-line interpreter.

c.name: C
c.description: A general-purpose programming language that has greatly influenced many other languages.
c.trivia: C was developed at Bell Labs as part of the development of Unix.

c-sharp.name: C#
c-sharp.description: A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft.
c-sharp.trivia: The name 'C#' was inspired by musical notation where # indicates a half-step higher.

caddy.name: Caddyfile
caddy.description: Configuration file format for the Caddy web server.

capnp.name: Cap'n Proto
capnp.description: A data interchange format and RPC system, designed as a successor to Protocol Buffers.
capnp.trivia: Created by a former Google engineer who also worked on Protocol Buffers v2.

clojure.name: Clojure
clojure.description: A dynamic, functional dialect of Lisp that runs on the JVM.
clojure.trivia: Rich Hickey spent about 2.5 years working on Clojure before releasing it publicly.

commonlisp.name: Common Lisp
commonlisp.description: A dialect of the Lisp programming language, standardized by ANSI.
commonlisp.trivia: Common Lisp was one of the first languages to have an object system (CLOS).

cpp.name: C++
cpp.description: A general-purpose programming language created as an extension of C.
cpp.trivia: Originally called 'C with Classes'. The ++ is the increment operator in C.

css.name: CSS
css.description: Cascading Style Sheets, a stylesheet language for describing document presentation.
css.trivia: CSS was first proposed by Håkon Wium Lie while working at CERN.

d.name: D
d.description: A systems programming language with C-like syntax and metaprogramming capabilities.
d.trivia: D was originally designed as a re-engineering of C++.

dart.name: Dart
dart.description: A client-optimized language developed by Google, used for Flutter apps.
dart.trivia: Dart was originally designed to replace JavaScript but evolved into Flutter's language.

devicetree.name: Device Tree
devicetree.description: A data structure for describing hardware in embedded systems.

diff.name: Diff
diff.description: A format for representing differences between files.

dockerfile.name: Dockerfile
dockerfile.description: A text document containing commands to assemble a Docker image.

dot.name: DOT (Graphviz)
dot.description: A graph description language for the Graphviz visualization software.

elisp.name: Emacs Lisp
elisp.description: A dialect of Lisp used as a scripting language in GNU Emacs.
elisp.trivia: Elisp is the most widely used Lisp dialect, due to Emacs's popularity.

elixir.name: Elixir
elixir.description: A dynamic, functional language running on the Erlang VM (BEAM).
elixir.trivia: José Valim was a Rails core team member before creating Elixir.

elm.name: Elm
elm.description: A functional language that compiles to JavaScript, known for having no runtime exceptions.
elm.trivia: Elm pioneered the Model-View-Update architecture pattern, later adopted by Redux.

erlang.name: Erlang
erlang.inventor: Joe Armstrong, Robert Virding, Mike Williams
erlang.description: A functional language designed for building massively scalable soft real-time systems.
erlang.trivia: Named after mathematician Agner Krarup Erlang and also stands for 'Ericsson Language'.

fish.name: Fish
fish.description: The Friendly Interactive SHell, a user-friendly command line shell.
fish.trivia: Fish has syntax highlighting and autosuggestions out of the box.

fsharp.name: F#
fsharp.description: A functional-first language that runs on .NET.
fsharp.trivia: F# was the first language to bring async/await syntax (before C# adopted it).

gleam.name: Gleam
gleam.description: A type-safe functional language that runs on the Erlang VM and JavaScript.
gleam.trivia: Gleam has no runtime exceptions and focuses on developer experience.

glsl.name: GLSL
glsl.description: The OpenGL Shading Language for programming GPU shaders.

go.name: Go
go.inventor: Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, Ken Thompson
go.description: A statically typed, compiled language designed at Google for simplicity and efficiency.
go.trivia: Ken Thompson, co-creator of Go, also co-created Unix and the C language.

graphql.name: GraphQL
graphql.description: A query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries.
graphql.trivia: GraphQL was developed internally by Facebook in 2012 before being released publicly.

haskell.name: Haskell
haskell.description: A purely functional programming language with strong static typing and lazy evaluation.
haskell.trivia: Named after logician Haskell Curry. Haskell influenced many modern language features.

hcl.name: HCL
hcl.description: HashiCorp Configuration Language, used for infrastructure as code.

hlsl.name: HLSL
hlsl.description: High-Level Shading Language for programming DirectX shaders.

html.name: HTML
html.description: HyperText Markup Language, the standard markup language for web pages.
html.trivia: Tim Berners-Lee invented HTML while working at CERN to share documents.

hyprlang.name: Hyprlang
hyprlang.description: Configuration language for Hyprland, a dynamic tiling Wayland compositor.

idris.name: Idris
idris.description: A purely functional programming language with dependent types.
idris.trivia: Named after a singing dragon from the British TV show Ivor the Engine.

ini.name: INI
ini.description: A simple configuration file format with sections and key-value pairs.

java.name: Java
java.description: A class-based, object-oriented language designed for portability.
java.trivia: Originally called Oak, then Green, before being named Java after Java coffee.

javascript.name: JavaScript
javascript.description: A high-level, dynamic programming language that powers the web.
javascript.trivia: Brendan Eich created the first version of JavaScript in just 10 days.

jinja2.name: Jinja2
jinja2.description: A modern and designer-friendly templating language for Python.
jinja2.trivia: Named after the Japanese word for 'temple', similar to Django's naming convention.

jq.name: jq
jq.trivia: jq is like sed for JSON data - you can slice, filter, map and transform.

json.name: JSON
json.description: JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data-interchange format.
json.trivia: JSON is a subset of JavaScript, but is language-independent.

julia.name: Julia
julia.inventor: Jeff Bezanson, Stefan Karpinski, Viral B. Shah, Alan Edelman
julia.description: A high-level, high-performance language for technical computing.
julia.trivia: Julia was designed to have the speed of C with the usability of Python.

kdl.name: KDL
kdl.description: The KDL Document Language, a document language with xml-like semantics.

kotlin.name: Kotlin
kotlin.description: A modern programming language that runs on the JVM, official for Android development.
kotlin.trivia: Named after Kotlin Island near St. Petersburg, where the JetBrains team is based.

lean.name: Lean
lean.description: A theorem prover and functional programming language.
lean.trivia: Lean 4 is a complete rewrite that can compile to native code.

lua.name: Lua
lua.inventor: Roberto Ierusalimschy, Waldemar Celes, Luiz Henrique de Figueiredo
lua.trivia: Lua means 'moon' in Portuguese. It was created in Brazil.

markdown.name: Markdown
markdown.description: A lightweight markup language for creating formatted text.
markdown.trivia: John Gruber created Markdown with Aaron Swartz's help.

matlab.name: MATLAB
matlab.description: A proprietary programming language for numerical computing and visualization.

meson.name: Meson
meson.description: An open source build system designed for speed and user-friendliness.

nginx.name: nginx
nginx.description: Configuration file format for the nginx web server.
nginx.trivia: nginx was created by Igor Sysoev to handle the C10K problem.

ninja.name: Ninja
ninja.description: A small build system focused on speed.
ninja.trivia: Ninja was created for building Chrome, which had over 30,000 source files.

nix.name: Nix
nix.description: A purely functional package manager and its configuration language.
nix.trivia: Nix ensures reproducible builds through cryptographic hashes of all inputs.

objc.name: Objective-C
objc.description: An object-oriented language that adds Smalltalk-style messaging to C.
objc.trivia: Objective-C was the main language for Apple development before Swift.

ocaml.name: OCaml
ocaml.inventor: Xavier Leroy, Jérôme Vouillon, Damien Doligez, Didier Rémy
ocaml.description: A multi-paradigm language with emphasis on functional programming.
ocaml.trivia: The 'O' in OCaml stands for 'Objective'. It was called Objective Caml before 2011.

perl.name: Perl
perl.description: A high-level, interpreted language known for text processing capabilities.
perl.trivia: Perl's motto is 'There's more than one way to do it' (TMTOWTDI).

php.name: PHP
php.description: A popular general-purpose scripting language suited for web development.
php.trivia: PHP originally stood for 'Personal Home Page', now 'PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor'.

python.name: Python
python.description: A high-level language emphasizing code readability and simplicity.
python.trivia: Named after Monty Python's Flying Circus, not the snake.

query.name: Tree-sitter Query
query.description: The S-expression based query language for tree-sitter parsers.
query.trivia: Tree-sitter queries are inspired by Scheme's S-expressions.

r.name: R
r.description: A language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.
r.trivia: R is named partly after the first names of its creators (Ross and Robert).

ron.name: RON
ron.description: Rusty Object Notation, a human-readable data serialization format.
ron.trivia: RON is designed to be more readable than JSON while supporting Rust's type system.

ruby.name: Ruby
ruby.description: A dynamic, object-oriented language focused on simplicity and productivity.
ruby.trivia: Named Ruby because it was a colleague's birthstone, and it follows Perl (another gem).

rust.name: Rust
rust.description: A systems programming language focused on safety, concurrency, and performance.
rust.trivia: Named after a fungus that is robust and distributed, like the language aims to be.

scala.name: Scala
scala.description: A language combining object-oriented and functional programming on the JVM.
scala.trivia: Scala stands for 'Scalable Language'. It was designed to grow with user demands.

scss.name: SCSS
scss.description: A preprocessor scripting language that extends CSS.
scss.trivia: SCSS is 'Sassy CSS' - a newer syntax that is a superset of CSS3.

sparql.name: SPARQL
sparql.description: A query language for RDF data and the Semantic Web.
sparql.trivia: SPARQL is a recursive acronym: 'SPARQL Protocol and RDF Query Language'.

sql.name: SQL
sql.inventor: Donald D. Chamberlin, Raymond F. Boyce
sql.description: Structured Query Language for managing relational databases.
sql.trivia: Originally called SEQUEL (Structured English Query Language) but was renamed due to trademark issues.

ssh-config.name: SSH Config
ssh-config.description: Configuration file format for OpenSSH client and server.

starlark.name: Starlark
starlark.description: A Python-like configuration language used by Bazel and Buck.
starlark.trivia: Originally called Skylark, renamed to Starlark for trademark reasons.

svelte.name: Svelte
svelte.description: A component framework that compiles to vanilla JavaScript at build time.
svelte.trivia: Unlike React or Vue, Svelte has no virtual DOM - it compiles to direct DOM manipulation.

swift.name: Swift
swift.description: A powerful and intuitive language for Apple platforms.
swift.trivia: Chris Lattner started Swift as a personal project in 2010, it became Apple's main language.

textproto.name: Text Proto
textproto.description: Human-readable text format for Protocol Buffers messages.

thrift.name: Thrift
thrift.description: A software framework for scalable cross-language services development.
thrift.trivia: Developed at Facebook and later donated to the Apache Software Foundation.

toml.name: TOML
toml.description: Tom's Obvious, Minimal Language - a configuration file format.
toml.trivia: TOML is named after its creator, Tom Preston-Werner (GitHub co-founder).

typescript.name: TypeScript
typescript.description: A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.
typescript.trivia: Anders Hejlsberg also created Turbo Pascal, Delphi, and C#.

typst.name: Typst
typst.description: A new markup-based typesetting system designed as a modern alternative to LaTeX.
typst.trivia: Typst compiles documents incrementally, making it much faster than LaTeX.

uiua.name: Uiua
uiua.description: A stack-based array programming language with a focus on simplicity.
uiua.trivia: Uiua uses Unicode symbols for its operators, creating very concise code.

vb.name: VB.NET
vb.description: A multi-paradigm, object-oriented language on the .NET Framework.

verilog.name: Verilog
verilog.description: A hardware description language used in electronic design automation.
verilog.trivia: Verilog was originally a proprietary language before becoming an IEEE standard.

vim.name: Vim Script
vim.description: The scripting language for configuring and extending the Vim editor.
vim.trivia: Vim stands for 'Vi IMproved'. Bram Moolenaar created it as an improvement to vi.

vue.name: Vue
vue.description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.
vue.trivia: Evan You created Vue while working at Google, inspired by AngularJS.

x86asm.name: x86 Assembly
x86asm.description: Assembly language for x86 architecture processors.

xml.name: XML
xml.description: Extensible Markup Language for encoding documents in a human-readable format.
xml.trivia: XML is a simplified subset of SGML, designed to be simpler and more usable on the web.

yaml.name: YAML
yaml.trivia: YAML originally stood for 'Yet Another Markup Language', now 'YAML Ain't Markup Language'.

zig.name: Zig
zig.description: A systems programming language designed for robustness and performance.
zig.trivia: Zig has no hidden control flow and aims to be a better C than C.

zsh.name: Zsh
zsh.description: An extended Bourne shell with many improvements.
zsh.trivia: Named after Zhong Shao, a Yale professor whose login was 'zsh'.
